chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick John Whitmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP ONLY AFTER serving 10 years intitial confinement.
Consecutive to: 14 CF 189 - count 4

superMiscConds.notes:
Joint and several.
Individual victims to be repaid first.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.

Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Payment plan to be worked out with agent after release.
Maintain full time employment.

No contact with victims or their residence.
No contact with co-defendant's.
Absolute sobriety.
Take part in any treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Order for DNA sample & surcharge done in case #14CF189.
